text:
I love easy new crock recipes. This had so few items and you just throw them in and stir,so I threw this together practically on my way out the door to work, that's how easy it was to prepare. It was a little burnt when I got home, it was on for 8hrs at least, on low. I used the cream cheese but I believe it would have been better with sour cream. The onion soup mix I put in as per many other cooks here, made it taste better but the burnt taste over powered it. I also think a little wine would have improved the taste, it was a little bit bland. Because of the ease of preparation I probably will make it again but not for so long.

Boatdrinks

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674162.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Tender, rich and flavorful!!  I've made stroganoff a number of ways over the years but no more - This will be the only way I will make it from now on.  Using the slow cooker is a bonus!  I doubled the meat, onion, water and soup plus I added a couple of minced garlic cloves, one beef bouillon cube, 1/2 packet of french onion soup mix before cooking.  Cooked 6 1/2 hours on low then stirred in 6 oz (3/4 of a package) cream cheese and a large dollop of sour cream.  I sauteed some fresh mushrooms in butter and stirred those in too.  Cooked another 1/2 hr on low and it was ready to serve - the beef was very tender and moist and the flavors rich and creamy.  Perfect consistency as a topping for noodles, toast, rice, etc.  Easy & delicious which means 5 Stars in my house!!

Display Name:
LOLeah
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/global/features/49.gif
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I read through a lot of the "most helpful positive reviews" and made a few changes based on them and this turned out great. 

1. Seasoned meat with salt and pepper.
2. Added a clove of chopped garlic.
3. Added 1/2 cup of water instead of 1/4 cup.
4. Added sauteed mushrooms in the last half hour of cooking.
5. Added a dollop of sour cream along with the cream cheese.

Really enjoyed this, can't wait to have the leftovers for lunch today!
Review:
Rating:

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is a super easy recipe, A few varations make it have some real flavor. Many of the reviews changed almost everything about the recipe! This is the base recipe and it is adjusted to personal taste (like most recipes are!) You can use what ever kind of beef you desire just adjust cooking time. I used ground round, browned and drained then cooked with onions before adding to the slow cooker. I used cream of mushroom soup( i dont care for large pieces of mushroom) added a little bit more water then called for and a beef boullion cube and a shake or two of garlic powder and some pepper. cooked for about 2 hours and then added the cream cheese and a dollop of sour cream served over egg noodles. it hit the spot.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe is on regular rotation in our house. Since it's just 2 of us, this is the perfect amount for dinner with leftovers for lunch the next day. I don't make all of the alterations that are suggested in the reviews, but usually I'll throw in some extra spices and herbs as I see fit (usually some minced garlic and a sprinkling of parsley and oregano). Sometimes I get 2 cans of golden mushroom soup, but sometimes I forget. If I do, it just makes the sauce stretch for more noodles, so may be a good idea to do for a family. This takes 10 min to throw in the crock pot before work and is amazing to have soon as we walk in the door and cook up a batch of egg noodles! Highly recommend- whether you feel like doing the alterations or not!

Display Name:
Beth

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/701647.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I am giving this recipe 4 stars, because I did make some changes. I couldn't find golden mushroom soup, so I used one can of cream of mushroom, one can of cream of mushroom with garlic, and one can of beef broth, and I didn't add any water. I then added a packet of Lipton's Beefy Onion soup mix, and let the soups, Worcestershire sauce and beef cook for about 6 hours on low. I added 4 oz of cream cheese (I bought the kind in stick form, not in the bowl, so it equals one stick) and about 1/2 cup of sour cream. I let that melt for about 30 minutes. While that was finishing, I made egg noodles and mixed it all together in one pot. It was absolutely fantastic. My husband, who hates mushrooms and beef stroganoff, ate two bowls of it and raved about it. So with the changes, it was amazing.

I made this recipe almost exactly as is.  I only changed the water to beef broth.  I agree that you'll have to double the meat if you want 4 servings....but, it was perfect for the 2 of us.   Also make sure to add some fresh mushrooms.  It was very thick and rich, so no need for any cornstarch.  The only problem I saw was the cream cheese does not melt uniformly in the sauce....sour cream might look better.

text:
Not sure how this recipe got such high ratings, because as-is the cooking time & temp is way off, it's very bland, & it's way too watery.  I added minced garlic, a 1/4 packet of Beefy Onion soup packet, 1/4 cup of beef broth to substitute the water, & a little less than the full can of golden mushroom.  At 4hrs low, is was a little overdone and still too soupy so I added a bit of flour and sour cream instead of the cream cheese.  I will not be trying this recipe again.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
VERY easy to prepare, and the onions do make a difference! I made two batches...the first one turned out so well that I made another one for my co-workers. I forgot the onions the second time, and it makes a big difference in my opinion. 

I also boiled egg noodles separately, getting them to "al dente/almost done", and mixed them directly into the stroganoff for the last 15 minutes. This works for getting the noodles well coated with the sauce, but any leftovers sitting in the pot will turn to mush quickly so I wouldn't recommend that.

This is a GREAT recipe for the whole family. I made this last week with the some modifications suggested by other members and my husband and 2 sons absolutely loved this dish. text:
This way soooo easy and sooo wonderful. My husband loved it so much he requests it for his birthday now.  I would DEFINITELY recommend the golden mushroom soup and not cream of mushroom. I also added a beef boullion cube, 1/2 packet onion soup mix, garlic, salt, pepper. Next time i might used less salt because there was plenty with the soups and boullion cube. Then I added the dollop of sour cream and 4 oz of cream cheese with a can of mushrooms about an hour before serving.  I could probably have stood less cream cheese because it made it very rich but my husband likes it that way.  I served it over egg noodles and it was excellent. but i think it would be very good over mashed potatos or a biscuit as well.  Definitely added to my "fool-proof" recipe list for when company comes.

Very good, however I did make a couple of changes. Added a cup of sour cream, doubled the meat, 1/2 envelope of onion soup, 1/2 cup of beef broth along w/ the 1/4 cup of water, 2 cans of cream of mush, sauted mushroom, garlic powder, salt and pepper to taste. You will need to season this dish. Family loved it!

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614249.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Beef Stroganoff is my favorite dish and this recipe was absolutely delicious with the recommended changes!!  I followed some of the other reviewers' advice and doubled the soup and water, added 1/2 pkg dried onion soup and 1/2 tsp garlic powder and I left out the onions entirely.  I added sauteed mushrooms about 1/2 hour before serving and only cooked the meat for 5 hours on low.  I added 1/3 cup of sour cream when I added the cream cheese, along with a slurry of 2 Tsp cold water and 1 Tsp corn starch to thicken everything up.  Instead of serving on top of egg noodles, I mixed it all up together in the crock pot before serving.  A - MA - ZING!!!

This is 5 stars, but only if you follow JILLYBEAN14's recommendations.  I agree with other posters that it shouldn't be left in the crockpot all day. Great comfort food.

country:
None
text:
Great recipe - you definitely need the GOLDEN mushroom soup.  I added 2 small containers of rinsed and chopped fresh button mushrooms (or you could use pre-sliced baby bellas) toward the end of cooking, and added cream cheese and sour cream until it looked like the right consistency.  If you're watching your sodium intake, don't make this dish...it's salty!!  But in a good way.  I also doubled the meat like some other people suggested.  Great winter recipe!

text:
This is a 5 star recipe with changes. Use 2 cans of soup and 1/2 cup water, add a boullion cube and half a packet of dried onion soup mix. Add sauteed mushrooms at the end as well as a dollop of sour cream if you have it on hand. Only needs to cook for 5-6 hours on low. Serve over whole wheat wide noodles. I might add a little more meat next time.

Review:
Rating:
3
dateLastModified:
2010-01-27T08:44:20.413
helpfulCount:
1
userID:
3970010
Display Name:
Shannon
isPro:
False
followersCount:
3
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
163
favoritesCount:
2699
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2586447.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I'm giving this 3 stars based only on flavor - and flavor I had to doctor up myself from reading other reviews. Overall, however, the sauce was WAY too runny (my fault for adding a bit more liquid than called for) and GLOPPY. I used 1+ lb beef stew meat which I diced into bite sized pieces (as I have a 17 month old), 1 can Golden mushroom condensed soup, 1 sweet onion, 1 T Worchestershire, 1/4 beef stock, 1/4 water (which I'll leave out next time), 1/4 tsp black pepper, salt, 2 cloves minced garlic, 1/2 pck. dry Lipton Onion soup mix. I cooked on low for 7 hours total - beef was VERY tender and the sauce and beef both delicious in flavor. At 6 hours I added 4 oz. cream cheese and that's when I noticed how liquidy the sauce was. My cream cheese never fully melded with the sauce and there were flecks and gloppy chunks of cream cheese throughout even after an hour more of cooking. I attempted to thicken the sauce with 1/2 c. cold water mixed with 1 T. cornstarch, however, this had absolutely no affect on the liquidy sauce. Again, the flavor of the sauce after my seasoning a bit more was EXCELLENT. The liquidness (I accept blame) and the gloppiness...not good. Will I make it again? Yes. I will either cut back on the liquid next time when preparing w/1 lb meat OR add a second 1 lb of meat to my recipe above. My husband commented there was too little beef and too much onion. Also, I'll try sour cream at the end instead of cream cheese, I think.

text:
Okay I did change this a bit. I wanted to make sure I had enough for left overs so I used 2 cans of the Golden Mushroom soup, plus I also added 1 packet of Lipton Beefy Onion soup mix. I had this in the slow cooker for about 6 hours. Only about an hour and half was on high. Wow, this was so good! My 6 year old son, who thinks that if something is a funny color or looks odd, will not eat it. It took some coaxing but I got him to try it and now he is begging me to make enough next time so that left overs will last a week! That makes this recipe a winner in my book! I should mention that my kids and I don't even like mushrooms but we all loved this and ate the mushrooms. They tasted like the egg noodles.

text:
My first attempt at using a slow cooker.  Easy.  Hearty.  Tasted good.  If you're like me, and get home late from work a lot, please note that the dish will dehydrate beyond all recognition after 10 hrs.  I managed to bring it back from the dead by stirring in another can of soup, and to my surprise, it still tasted fine.  I might try it again and double the liquids for good measure...

I had high hopes for this recipe based on all the favorable reviews and its ease of preparation. Unfortunately it did not live up to expectations. While it smelled great cooking, the flavor and texture left a lot to be desired. The cream cheese made the meat/soup mixture extremely thick, so I added a 1/2 cup of sour cream to try to thin it out a bit (per other reviewers). My kids didn't like it either. Definitely not a stroganoff as I know it. I will not be making this recipe again. :(

text:
Delicious!  I read some reviews and made changes accordingly.  I used dried minced onion, golden mushroom soup and half a small container of sour cream, 4 cloves of minced garlic and seasoned with salt and pepper.  Also added mushrooms.  The sauce was very thick, even with the amount of water recommended so I added about 1/2 C. more throughout cooking.  When it came time to add the cream cheese, I added the amount said and also the rest of the container of sour cream.  It was really great, I will make this recipe a regular.

Review:
Rating:

dateLastModified:
2010-01-02T19:06:03.37
helpfulCount:

userID:
2859350
Display Name:
Megan
isPro:
False
followersCount:
4
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
38
favoritesCount:

recipesCount:

reviewsCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/266760.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I had a frozen (about 1 1/3 lb) rump beef roast in the freezer.  I thawed it in the fridge about 24 hours, then cut it into about 2-3" cubes, cutting out the big chunks of fat, too.  I threw the cubes in the crock pot & the called-for ingredients, along with double the called for amount of both golden mushroom soup & water.  I also added garlic, salt and a generous amount of black pepper.  I didn't measure the ingredients, just eyeballed it.  I thought it was cooking on low but thanks to a loose knob on my crock pot, was actually cooking on High.  I checked it after about 4 hours and it looked pretty done.  Turned it down to Low after realizing the mistake, then took the big chunks of meat out with a slotted spoon and shred them into smaller bits and eliminated the rest of the major fat chunks.  I threw the meat back in the crock pot & added my brick of cream cheese,  sliced into about 5 chunks, a dollop of sour cream & about two Tbps of beef broth.  I cooked it about 10 more minutes on Low, stirring occasionally for the cream cheese to mix well, before eating over No Yolk noodles.  Delicious!!!  The only thing I'll do differently next time is make sure I let it cook a bit longer with the cream cheese in it because I could see the little white chunks, even though it tasted smooth & great!

I used this as my base recipe for dinner tonight simple because i did not have any sour cream on hand.This is what i did.I carmalized my onions, added 2 cloves of garlic,1/4 Tsp Thyme & salt & pepper,1 Tbls Chopped chives,Tbls Parsley,2 1/2 cup's Beef broth and a wee bit of cornstarch to thicken it.Served over hot cooked pasta.Kid's loved it!! city:

region:

country:
None
text:
This is so easy in a slow cooker and such comforting food.  First time I followed recipe exactly and stew meat turned out sort of bland.  Second time I made it, I adjusted the recipe with four additional ingredients which I already had on hand. 1) Garlic salt and 2) black pepper for seasoning(HIGHLY RECOMMENDED to reduce blandness of stew meat), rub all over the lovely tender meat. 3) Beef broth instead of water.  4) Sliced white mushrooms to add to slow cooker in last 30 minutes of cooking.  They all made this dish so much more tastier.  The next time I will add sour cream as some reviewers have suggested.  Keeper for all those busy working days but still want to eat home cooked food.  Serve over No Yolks Noodles.

text:
I don't think I have ever left a review, but this one deserves it! This was the best best stroganoff I have ever had. I followed the advice of Momsavedbygrace and Jillybean14 and doubled the meat, and soup. I used 2 cups of onions, diced very fine, light cream cheese, 1/4 c reduced fat sour cream and a whole packet of Lipton Beefy Onion Soup Mix. I sauteed 24 oz of mushrooms, drained the liqiud, and added it in the last 1/2 hour. I also added 2 TBLS cornstarch 10 minutes before I added the cream cheese and sour cream. Served over whole wheat egg noodles and it was so delicious! Thanks for a great starting point, Jessica, and thank you to the reviewers who modified!

text:
I loved this recipe, with a few modifications.  I seasoned the meat with black pepper and garlic powder then toss with about a Tbsp of flour as this helps thicken the sauce while cooking.  I used 2 cans of Campbell's Condensed Golden Mushroom soup, 2 beef bouillon cubes dissolved in 1/2 cup water and I also added a dollop of sour cream with the cream cheese just before serving.  This is "true" comfort food, in my opinion!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/282541.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
With reviews 5 stars++!! YUM!!  In crock-pot combine meat, golden mushroom soup, onion, Worcestershire, water, and bouillon cube.  Season with salt, pepper, and garlic.  Cook on LOW setting for 6 hours. During the last hour of cooking, stir in cream cheese and a large dollop of sour cream. Sauté mushrooms in butter and set aside.   Cook noodles and drain water.  Serve stroganoff over egg noodles and top each serving with the sautéed mushrooms.

text:
I've finally found the best Stroganoff recipe known to man! I took the advice of other reviewers and added a 1/2 packet of onion soup mix to the sauce. I decided that since I had over a pound of stew meat I would increase the sauce by adding another can of mushroom soup as well. I only had one can of golden mushroom, so the other can ended up being plain old cream of mushroom. I was in such a hurry the morning I made this I did not add any additional seasonings, not even pepper, (which I put in everything!) and it still had enough flavor (I also kinda eyeballed the water and Worcestershire) for me. I did cheat and use 4oz of sour cream instead of cream cheese--I had an open container of the stuff and decided to get rid of it instead of cracking open a brand new package of Philly. Next time I will try it with the cream cheese for sure. I served this over buttered egg noodles--the best!

this came out decent - I maded the following changes: TWO cans of golden mushroom soup, added salt, pepper, garlic powder, minced pickled garlic, and used beef broth instead of water. Then added fresh mushrooms half an hour before done and sour cream before serving. Even with all of this, I would marinate the meat overnight to make it more tender. Probably use Lawry's Pepper and Onion Steak Marinade and my wife suggests chopped parsley on top before serving and maybe adding some red wine while slow cooking.

Turned out great.  I agree that you should double the sauce by adding 2 cans of the golden mushroom soup, doubling the amount of water, and doubling the meat.  Also add spices, such as salt, pepper, and garlic.  Also, it was definitely done after cooking for 5 hours on low, no need to cook for 8 hours.  I found it odd that one of the main ingredients was not included in the original recipe: mushrooms!  Definitely a must.  I will be making this again.

text:
This was so yummy.  I made a few changes tho.  Doubled the cream of mushroom soup (did not have golden cr. of mush) added a jar of sliced mushrooms, doubled water and worstershire sauce and added a beef stew season packet with cut up beef stew meat and chopped onions.  I cooked in slow cooker on high for 3-4 hrs. then turned down to low for about 2 hrs. I used about 2oz. of cream cheese and 1/2 cup of sour cream near the end.  Served over buttered noodles and baby peas on the side.  I took some over for my mom and dad and they loved it.  This is a keeper. thanks

text:
I have used this website for recipies for about 4 years. I have never reviewed anything until now. I acually created an account just to review this.

This is so yummy I just do not know what to say. I always follow the recipie to the T with one exeption, I DOUBLE IT because the serving size sugsested is not enough. My Mom who is the best cook ever never thought of using cream cheese instead of sour cream...trust me this makes it so tasty. As usual with all recipies adjust to your liking but just try as is first. I have thrown in an extra beef boullion cube and maybe a little sour cream to thicken (or more cream cheese if I have it) but this is just awesome as is. My daughter even brags about my stroganoff to her friends...sorry Jessica but since my kid knows no better I have to take your claim to fame on this! Thanks for the recipie, I would have not thought of cream cheese vs. sour cream, now I will never go back!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I have read many reviews and my first change was I made this a "Pressure Cooker Stroganoff", rather than a "Slow Cooker".  I used double the meat and double the gravy ingredients... this was my only mistake.  There was too much gravy.  I also didn't have mushrooms, but will add them next time.  That will be my only other modification to what I had done already.  I coated the meat in flour and browned it in a separate pot.  At the same time, I sweat the onions in the pressure cooker.  I used a boullion cube and an entire package of onion soup mix.  I added garlic, worstechire and pepper, but no salt because the onion soup, worstechire and boullion have plenty.  I added the browned meat to the gravy mixture and heat the pressure cooker on high until full pressure and then turned it down low for 60 minutes.  The meat just fell apart in your mouth.  Delicious!  Thank you for this fantastic recipe!

text:
Tried this recipe for the 1st time, and my husband went for THIRDS! :)  I incorporated the changes suggested by others (1.  double the meat, soup & water, 2.  add salt, pepper, one clove of chopped garlic, and 1/2 packet of onion soup mix to the mixture, 3.  add fresh mushrooms 30 minutes before serving and 4.  add 2 large dallups of sour cream when mixing in the cream cheese).  The meal came out really fantastic served over egg noodles.  I'd recommend this easy recipe in a heartbeat!

userID:

Display Name:
Josephine Roeper
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1902560.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I followed the advice of JILLYBEAN14 and I did the following modifications: (1) add salt, pepper, and garlic, (2) double the sauce but keep the cream cheese and worcestershire the same, (3) use Golden Mushroom, not Cream of Mushroom or don't make this at all, (4) reduce the cooking time to about 5-6 hours on low, (5) add a "dollup" of sour cream when you add the cream cheese to get an extra "tang", (6) add a bullion cube, (7) add a half packet of onion soup mix, (8) serve over egg noodles, (9) add sauteed mushrooms about 1/2 an hour before serving.

text:
I gotta say, this was good.  But, it's becoming a big pet peeve of mine when there are like 8 modified ingredients to a recipe listed in the reviews.  I don't mean this in a crabby way, but I read the reviews after adding the recipe to my shopping list and shopping for the stuff - then to find out the changes were things that I didn't have on hand (in this case I couldn't find golden mushroom soup and just got cream of mushroom soup THEN read the reviews).  I'd love to start a movement....if there are many changes to a recipe - post an 'improved' version so I can avoid the frustration of seeing that I shouldn't have bothered making it with plain mushroom soup :)

text:
This recipe is yummy!! I kept the amount of beef, (fat-free) cream cheese, and Worcestershire sauce the same as directed on the recipe. I increased the gravy by using two cans of golden mushroom soup and a half cup of water. I chopped up a medium onion and added a generous amount of fresh, sliced mushrooms--probably 8oz as we love mushrooms.  I also added a packet of onion soup mix and some cayenne pepper.  I set the slow cooker on low for 8 hours. Love this recipe and will make again soon!

I followed the recipe pretty close with a few modifications.  I substituted beef broth for water and doubled the measurements on the broth and the cream of mush soup.  I also added garlic, salt, pepper and a few tablespoons of red wine.  I didn't read many reviews that added red wine, but I thought it made a huge difference...definitely add it!  All in all...it was a huge hit and I highly recommend this dish!

text:
This was an awesome recipe!  I did follow Jillybeans14 review and modified it like she said.  In case you can't find her review this is what I did.  I added garlic, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, 2 cans of the Golden Mushroom soup, 1 beef bouillon cube, and sauteed mushrooms 1/2 hour before serving. I also cubed the cream cheese and stirred in and put my crock pot on warm and let it sit for about 15 minutes.  It was very tasty!  Even my very picky 7-year-old loved it!

text:
This was good and I would definitely make it again.  I followed the advice of others and used double meat & soup, and a whole onion.  To ensure that it did not burn I cooked it on low (8 hour setting) for only 6 hours.  Cooked the meal for 6 hours and put it in the refrigerator for the next day (without the cream cheese).  Warmed up the meal on the stove for dinner the next day and added about 8 oz. of cream cheese for texture.  Next time I will probably use 2 small onions and fresh mushrooms.

text:
Fantastic!  I used JilyBean's 7/2005 suggestions,
"(1) add salt, pepper, and garlic, (2) double the sauce but keep the cream cheese and worcestershire the same,(3) use Golden Mushroom, not Cream of Mushroom or don't make this at all, (4) reduce the cooking time to about 5-6 hours on low, (5) add a "dollup" of sour cream when you add the cream cheese to get an extra "tang", (6) add a bullion cube, (7) add a half packet of onion soup mix, (8) serve over egg noodles, (9) add sauteed mushrooms about 1/2 an hour before serving.",  minus the onion soup mix and it came out very good but I think next time I will try it with the onion soup. Thanks for the recipe and the advice!  Everyone in my house loved it! Even my 2 year old had 2 servings :o).

text:
I followed the other reviews here and added half a pkt of onion soup mix,( I diddnt omit the onion entirely, I used maybe a 1/4 cup of it)and dbled the condensed soup. Next time I won't double that because we had so much sauce left over. I diddnt add water,I used half a can of wine instead, and sauteed a jar of mushrooms I had on hand and threw them the last hour of cooking. I added a tablespoon of tomato paste,and some garlic, and a tsp. of boullion paste. I used sliced/cubed chuck steak, because it was on sale and I seasoned it with garlic salt and pepper and shook it in flour and seared it in the skillet for a bit before adding it to the crockpot. The meat was so tender and delicious. I did add extra pepper to the sauce.
I did use 4 oz of cream cheese, I even cubed it and there were still some little lumps in the sauce. I added sour cream as well. I enjoyed it and the family liked it too.

text:
I thought this was a great, easy recipe. I used top sirloin instead of stew meat, and sliced it into strips. I doubled the recipe, left out the onions, and added 1/4 cup white wine and a packet of onion soup mix. I cooked it on high for an hour, then on low for a few hours. When it was time to mix the cream cheese in, I took out the beef so I could mix up the sauce easier (there are a lot of clumps) then I put the beef back in. Served it with egg noodles.

This recipe was just ok. The flavor was decent (I've had better) and the convenience factor would have been great - EXCEPT that I found the amount of ingredients didn't lend itself to an 8 hour simmer fest in my crock pot. By the time I came home after work, half the beef mixture was crusted over and burnt to the sides of the crock pot. And it was on it's lowest setting. Perhaps next time if I double it there will be more food to cook through. Ahh, who am I kidding? I won't be making this again. I'm compiling great recipes to wow my future husband when we get married. This one definetly doesn't make the cut! I'll keep looking.

This was absolutely delicious!! I solved the problem of the cream cheese that other people noted, but putting in the softened cream cheese an hour before the stroganoff was done. I also added 1/8 cup red wine (replacing half of the water), some garlic powder and mushrooms to the recipe. This was quick, easy and delicous!!

text:
This was yummy and made the house smell great while simmering throughout the day. There are some good suggestions, use beef broth instead of water and  substitute the onion with a packet of onion soup mix - but don't do both, the result will be a bit salty, choose one or the other and you can't go wrong. I also added some mushrooms and served over egg noodles - Delish!

text:
This is yummy.  No, it's not dinner party fare, but it's perfect for a good family meal.  My Mom has dentures and needs soft, chewable meat, and this is it!  My picky husband eats seconds.  I could just binge on the gravy.  A few thoughts.  I found the original recipe a bit thin, so I doubled the meat and thickened it a bit.  I recommend thickening with corn starch rather than flour, because flour dims the sharp flavor.  I also served it over mashed potatoes the second time and my husband liked it better than with noodles.  Mmmm.  I'll serve this again, and soon.

A nice Sunday meal and one of the first I really liked from the slow cooker.

This was good, but not as fantastic as I would have thought by the other reviews. I, too, agree that with the cream cheese, the dish is missing that "stroganoff" feel to it. Also, it was very thin to me so I will probably try to thicken it with corn starch next time. I did, however, gave it "4 stars" because my fiancee' specifically asked for it in his lunch the next day. All-in-all, very easy slow-cooker recipe for busy nights.

text:
This was a great recipe and has just become a family favorite!!!  The prep time on this was 10 minutes max and then it's ready and has your house filled with a yummy aroma when you walk in the door from work!  You can't get any easier! I changed it just a bit though.  I used 2 cans of cream of mushroom soup (and added 2 cans of water instead of the 1/4 cup of water) instead of golden mushroom soup because I had it on hand, added 2 bouillon cubes, 1 pkg of Lipton onion soup mix in addition to the chopped onion and instead of cream cheese used 8oz of sour cream.  After it had cooked all day I boiled up egg noodles and stirred them in a few minutes before serving.  It was excellent and my family loved it.  Next time I will add fresh mushrooms for an extra kick.

text:
This really had a great flavor!!!  The ONLY problem I had with this recipie was the texture of the sauce.  It was a bit runny for me.    Next time I will add a bit of flour to thicken it up. I used 98% fat free soup and fat free cream cheese and it took nothing away from the flavor. My husband mentioned that next time we should marinade the meat before cooking for added flavor.  I served this over rotini noodels and the leftovers are just as good if not better.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Made a mistake at the store and bought red cooking wine instead of cooking sherry.  I used 1/4 cup of this instead of the water and substituted dry onion soup mix for the onion.  Also I used cream of mushroom soup and sour cream instead of golden mushroom soup and cream cheese.  I made the recipe for a potluck so I stirred the egg noodles in prior to serving.  This was incredibly easy and to my surprise actually tastes like stroganoff!  (5 hours on high is too long.  It was probably ready after 3 or 4 hours.)

text:
This recipe taste great! I did make a few adjustments based on other reviews: I added 1/4 cup of cooking Sherry, Cream of Mushroom soup instead of Golden Mushroom, and I did not add Mushrooms. I also used Sour Cream at the end just because I am so use to the flavor but next time I will try the Cream Cheese. This is delicious and a definite keeper in my household. Thanks for sharing!!

I substituted a red wine vinegar for the Worchester sauce, the cream cheese was a good tip and so I split the cream cheese and sour cream.  I also used minced garlic and minced onion [converted]. One more, corn starch is much better than flour.  My mom taught me that one.  I served it over wide buttered noodles and a salad.  My picky grandchildren who are never appreciative thought it was "OK" but I noticed they took seconds.

text:
I made some changes based on personal preferences and some of the recommended changes in the reviews.  First off, is used a sirloin steak (it was on sale), aded pepper and some garlic powder, used sour cream instead of cream cheese,  used 1/2 cup of beef broth (we like extra sauce) and mixed 1 Tbs. corn starch with 2 Tbs. water and used that to thicken the sauce just before adding the sour cream.  Results: delicious -hubby said I could make that again anytime.  Might saute some extra mushrooms to add next time.

My husband actually made this delicious stroganoff, but with a few changes with the ingredients. Instead of using beef stew meat, he used venison. Instead of using golden mushroom soup, he used cream of mushroom soup, plus he added 2 (6-5 ounce) cans of mushrooms (pieces & stems), drained well. Display Name:
MISSJODIE

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/6292145.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was absolutely wonderful using JillyBean14's suggestions.  I did switch out the suggestion for bouillon cubes with Better Than Bouillon as it has less salt in it.  You are getting enough salt from the golden mushroom soup and onion soup mix you really don't need more.  You can also leave out the suggestion of adding more salt.  It just depends on how much salt you like.  Definitely add pepper though.  Next time, I plan sear/brown the meat, but not cooking it all the way before adding to the slow cooker for more flavor and to reduce cooking time.  We like the meat to be falling apart which requires a longer cooking time so searing the meat will reduce it.  We didn't use any sour cream as we thought it was amazing without it.  Maybe next time, one of us will add a bit to their plate just to see. I love the extra sauce too.  We will definitely be making this again.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:

EAK

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
As many other reviews state, modification to this  recipe is necessary. I agree with adding a 1/2 packet of onion soup mix. I  added one portobello mushroom cap, sliced in thick chunks. I peppered the meat before it went in. I added another pack of variety mushrooms when there was 30 minutes cook time left. I think 2 cans of soup are necessary. In my cylinder crock pot, the liquid in the recipe barely covered the 1 lb of meat and onions. Perhaps a low sodium beef stock would also work to have enough liquid. Make sure you temper the sour cream or cream cheese. You cannot add cold cream to the hot dish. The premise of a good recipe is the ingredient list- the enhancements make a meal you would want to have again.

made the revised recipe after reading the comments. only thing I changed was I didn't  have onion soup mix so replaced the 1/4 cup of water with French onion soup.  cooked fresh mushrooms the night before. just before serving added the mushrooms, sour cream, and cream cheese. I used all of "Jillybean14's" recommendations, which were almost perfect.  To make it perfect, I need a lot of dried dill weed sprinkled in at the end.  That gives it a perfect finish, and reminds me of how my mom used to make it.  I hope some of you will try it with the dill weed...and don't be bashful in how much you add.  Love this recipe with Jillybean14's additions and mine; a keeper.

None
text:
This recipe was wonderful and my husband and I really enjoyed it!  Best beef stroganoff recipe ever.
I made a few changes but pretty much followed to a "T".
Following revisions:
Used 2 lb chuck roast cut up into cubes.  
I thickened the gravy, at the end of cook time before adding sour cream,  with one T of cornstarch mixed with two T of water by recommendation of another reviewer.
I also used sour cream instead of cream cheese, 1/4 C.
Next time, I would like to add fresh mushrooms for more depth and texture.
You have to try this at least once!  This is truly amazing.  Thank you, Jessica!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1357204.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
CAN BE ALTERED WITH CHICKEN TOO!  Here are some changes we made:

4 chicken breasts (I place them in frozen)
1 10.75oz can golden mushroom soup
1 can cream celery soup
2 tbs Worcestershire sauce
1 tbs yellow mustard
1-2 tbs sherry cooking wine
1/2 cup chicken or veg broth
1/2 lb cream cheese

Add all ingredients except the cream cheese (add this about 30 min before serving)  Cook low 8hrs and about 10 if starting from frozen.  I also switch to high once i add the cream cheese and i shred the chicken using 2 forks before adding cream cheese. enjoy!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Made this for my wife and 2 other couples - all three of the ladies being much more experienced cooks than me, so I was a little worried.  Everybody LOVED it!  Two guests even went back for 3rds!  Sorry Pheobe, but I like reading the reviews to see how people have made recipes their own.  I took the advice of many reviewers and made changes as I went.  I've  never been a big fan of stewing beef, but I bought two packs and cut about 1/3 of it away, leaving only the good parts and marinated it overnight so the flavours had lots of time to meld.  Added the cream cheese, sour cream and sauteed onions/mushrooms 45 minutes before it was done cooking.  The sauce was thick and tasty and the meat was the most tender I'd eaten in a long time after the 6 and 1/2 hours in the slow cooker, on low.  The guests want it again next week!  LOL

text:
This is the best crock pot meal I have ever made! I made it for Christmas dinner and served with French bread. I doubled the recipe, marinated the meat overnight with salt, pepper, garlic and Worcestershire sauce, Lipton onion soup mix, 2 beef bullion cubes, water and soup. Did the 4 ounces cream cheese and 2 serving spoonfuls of sour cream. Very full of flavor. I'm been making recipes from all recipe for a long time and have never been disappointed but this is the first recipe I'm willing to take the time to rate and review! Served it with egg noodles and sauted mushrooms and onions.

country:
None
text:
Unfortunately I need to agree with some of the more critical of reviewers. You really DO have to modify this recipe to max out it's potential. It was a hit with the boyfriends two children (9 year old and 14 year old boy). Here's the mods: 
I had two medium packages  of stewing beef (3-4 pnds). I dredged the beef in flour and browned it on the outside. 
I kept the onion (used sweet onion and sauteed it before putting in slow-cooker) and added fresh sauteed garlic.
I did not add water - but put the mushroom soup, onion and cream cheese in the crock pot, cooking on low for the entire workday. 
When I came home I tasted the copious broth and added some Dijon mustard. I too served over egg noodles. Fantastic!

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674164.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Absolutely loved this recipe however I did read the reviews and made changes accordingly.  I doubled the sauce except the cream cheese and the Worcestershire sauce.  I added a full onion, garlic, pepper and instead of the water used beef stock instead (double the amount it calls for).  30 minutes prior to it being done, I sautéed fresh sliced mushrooms with butter, pepper, a touch of herb de Provence and sherry for about 5 minutes over medium heat then added to the slow cooker mixing thoroughly.  Cooked extra wide egg noodles according to directions on package, adding butter when done and drained.  While noodles are cooking, added 4-5 ounces cream cheese and a dollop of sour cream.  My husband raved about this!! And he is a phenomenal cook himself so I'm always nervous doing something for him because he is MacGyver in the kitchen. Only thing I would do differently next time is double the meat!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
It came out really tasty!  The only changes I made was that I made my own Golden Mushroom soup (did a search online) since I had none in the house and I didn't feel like going to the store to buy something with a bunch of preservatives and sodium in it.  Rather than adding the onions later I put them in my soup with fresh mushrooms.  I didn't add any extra salt since the Worcestershire sauce is salty (it has anchovies in it).  Also I seared the beef before adding to the crock pot since I prefer to do that.  I cooked on high for 4 hours and it was on warm for another hour.  It was the best I've ever had, the meat was super tender but not mealy and I'll make it again, with my own mushroom soup of course.

text:
I made this the first time as its listed here, and my rating is based on that. Great base for a recipe, however lacks a bit of flavor. What I've done is I do not add the water (I've found most recipes here that call for adding water usually don't need it), add a cube of beef broth, and a packet of french onion soup mix. The flavor comes out pretty good this way. I also add sliced mushrooms to mine in the last 3-4 hours.

Loved it! I followed Jillybean14's directions (including doubling sauce but not cream cheese & Worcestershire). I had leftover ribeye, so I sautéed the onion & added mushroom in a stockpot, then the rest of the ingredients (plus a little extra water) & simmered about 20 minutes before adding in the cooked meat. Simmered a bit more, then added cream cheese & sour cream. Husband said he preferred more sour cream, so next time I may increase the sour cream & decrease the cream cheese.

text:
This recipe was so delicious, I will definitely make this again.  I revised the original recipe per some suggestions.  Here is how I made it: Used fresh mushrooms and put them in the bottom of the slow cooker as the first layer.  They came out wonderful.  I used tbone steak, trimmed and deboned.  Wow it was fantastic.  Added fresh garlic, sweet peppers,  salt and pepper.  I also doubled the soup and water.  Next time I will likely use 1.5 cans of soup and see how it comes out.  I cooked on high for 5 hours.  When adding the cream cheese, I also added a heaping table spoon of onion dip.  I didn't have sour cream on hand but had chip dip.  My guests were happy and I guess that is all you can ask!  Can't wait to eat the left overs tonight!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Delicious!  My husband loves beef stroganoff, I am usually not a fan.  This was a recipe both of us loved and he said it was better than any he'd had at a restaurant.  The only change I made was to make the condensed golden mushroom soup myself, I don't ever buy the canned stuff any more.  I just sauteed some mushrooms and onions in a little butter, added in some flour & spices and then whisked in some beef stock and the Worcestershire sauce called for and poured it over the beef.  When it was almost ready to serve, I added in the cream cheese and a little bit of milk and then served it over egg noodles.  Even my kids liked it - this recipe is a keeper!  Goes great served with some buttered carrots on the side.  UPDATE:  I now substitute plain yogurt for the cream cheese and it is just as delicious only better for you.

After reading through the reviews, I decided to double the sauce as well. I did this by making the following changes: added a can of cream of onion soup in addition to the golden mushroom soup, added an extra tablespoon of Worcestershire sauce, used 1/2 cup of beef broth instead of water, added a few cloves of garlic, used 8 ounces of cream cheese, and added a spoonful of sour cream at the end. It was very good and I plan to make this again!

text:
I followed edited recipe and used pepper garlic powder and salt, 1/2 cup beef broth, 2 cans of soup, half packet onion dip mix, kept Worcestershire the same (also added almost a Tbs of ketchup) I didn't have an onion so I added some minced onion instead. Used about a pound and a half of stew meat. I added 4 oz of fresh mushrooms towards the end and the cream cheese I kept the same (added an hour before it was done cooking to blend) and also added at least as much sourcream at the end. This was... OK. Next time I think it needs a large can of mushrooms instead of fresh. Also I cooked it for the 6 hours instead of 5 because I was waiting for the cream cheese to blend, and the meat was kinda dry. Not bad though. Ate it with egg noodles. My boyfriend liked it more than I did.

Loved this recipe. Use beef stock instead of water and if you find out more people are coming than anticipated (and it is too late to add more beef) then simply add a pound of mushrooms and another can of soup. These additions only need a couple of hours in the slow cooker.

text:
I was really disappointed when I made this for Sunday dinner! I followed every step and I did not change any of the ingredients, and I also cooked it on low and let it cook for the amount of time it called for! When I was making our plates for dinner I put the egg noodles on the plate first then I opened my crockpot and was going to use a fork to pull the out and place it over the noodles when I seen that it looked like a big gray pile of shredded beef, I had to use a spoon to get it out and it had no taste whatsoever! I did not like to much of anything about this recipe except for the fact I used my crockpot and didn't have to be on my feet constantly watching the pot on the stove! I will never make this again!

Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:

helpfulCount:
0
userID:
6245288
Display Name:
Trisha
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
29
favoritesCount:
64
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674153.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
2 pound cubed beef stew meat or chuck roast 2 (10.75 ounce) can condensed golden mushroom soup 3/4 cup chopped onion 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce 1/4 cup water (more if needed) 1/4 cup low sodium beef stock (more if needed) 1/3 cup sour cream 2 ounces cream cheese (reduced fat works well) 1/2 pack French onion soup mix Salt and pepper, to taste 3 cloves garlic, minced 8oz. mushrooms, sliced Pat of butter DIRECTIONS 1. In slow cooker, combine meat, mushroom soup, chopped onions, minced garlic, Worcestershire, dry soup mix, pepper, stock and water. 2. Cook on low setting for 5-6 hours. 3. During cooking time, sauté the mushrooms in butter about 4 mins. 4. Put sautéed mushrooms in slow cooker last 30 minutes of cooking time 5. Check sauce if it needs salt or extra pepper. 6. Best served over buttered egg noodles.

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
I used what I had on hand and my family enjoyed it. I used thin cut shoulder steak and regular cream of mushroom soup (not golden), I had a 12 oz tub of cream cheese spread that was maybe only 3/4 full and I put all of that in.  I used a tablespoon and 1/2 Worcestershire and I used chicken broth instead of water.  I added a little black pepper and a teaspoon or so of minced garlic. I put the cream cheese in the crockpot at the same time I put all the other ingredients in. I cooked on high for about an hour and turned it down to low for another 4 hours and then stirred in cooked elbow macaroni and served.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614249.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I have a similar one except with chicken.  Can either use 4 chicken breasts or chicken tenders.
Put chicken in crock pot with 1/2 to 1 pkg of dry Italian salad dressing, 1 can cream of chicken soup.  Cook for 3-4 hours, then add 4-8 oz cream cheese, cook for another 1/2 hour.
We found the full pkg of Italian salad dressing was too strong, so use only 1/2 pkg.  Depending on the number of chicken breasts or tenders, use your judgment on the amount of cream cheese.

text:
The whole family loved this one, even the picky eater.  Changes I made: use 1/4 c beef bouillon instead of water, add 1/2 tsp each salt & pepper, add 1 clove minced garlic, use sour cream instead of cream cheese.  I also mixed 1 T corn starch with 2T cold water & mixed in with sour cream as a thickener.  Next time I'll use 1.5 pounds of meat and keep all other measurements the same.

text:
I made this with a couple of changes suggested by other reviewers. I used a chuck roast that I cubed, added some garlic, 1/2 package of Beefy Onion soup mix and 1/3 c sour cream. I used beef broth instead of water. I also added sliced mushrooms about 30 mins before serving. Served over hot buttered egg noodles. It had lots of flavor and the sour cream & cream cheese mix gave a nice tangy sauce. Will definitely make this again.

text:
Delicious with the following adjustments based on others feedback:
Double recipe - 2 pounds good sirloin 
Low setting 5-6 hours.
No water, only beef broth - 1 can.
No chopped onions. Use 1 packet of Onion soup mix. 
Add a large dollop (1/2 cup) of sour cream at the end.
Add sauteed mushrooms near end.

text:
This turned out really good...definitely a keeper for the crock pot.  I doulbled this recipe and it translated really well.  Like most other users, I made some modifications like adding onion soup mix and sour cream.   Since I was doubling, I used 1 packet of onion soup mix, and two heaping TB's of sour cream along with 8 ozs. of cream cheese.  I used a large can of Progresso's "Recipe Starters" cream of mushroom soup and even though it wasn't golden mushroom, it still turned out really good.  Also, I sauteed slices of portobello mushroom in butter and topped it when serving.  Delish!!

I read a bunch of the reviews and followed some of the alterations.  I sauteed the onion with some fresh garlic and added the meat to just brown the outside, not cook all the way through, before adding it to the sauce in the slow cooker.  I added about a half cup of sour cream for an extra tang. Served it over egg noodles and it was pretty good.  I'll probably make it again as it was easy and my kids also ate it.  It was very good as left overs the next day for lunch too :)

text:
Great and easy recipe!  Added black pepper and garlic salt at the outset.  About an hour from serving we decided it needed more seasoning, so I added a t. of beef granules (to a doubled recipe).  Perfectly seasoned at that point!  Also like I said, I needed to double the recipe, but I only used 4 oz of cream cheese (reduced fat) and threw in just a bit of reduced fat sour cream that I had on hand (maybe 2 T.).  Very simple and I loved the fact that we didn't need to brown the beef before putting it in the crock pot.  Yeah sure, that may have made it better, but for its simplicity, this was wonderful.

text:
I add salt,pepper,garlic powder,flour and brown the beef stew or chuck roast. 1/2 cup or more beef broth in place of water. I use 2 cans of soup (condensed golden mushroom soup)Cook in slow cooker 3 hours on low .If i do not have onion,use packet onion soup mix.Add a little sour cream and a little cream cheese and stir very good just before serving. I serve over noodles or rice

This was a good recipe, but I did double the golden mushroom soup, added a cup of onions and also added fresh mushrooms.  After I added the cream cheese, it was really bland.  I then added 4 oz of sour cream and it really helped.  In my opinion the cream cheese makes it creamy, but does nothing for the flavor and adding sour cream is a must otherwise to me it was bland.  My husband really liked it which is great.  I thought it was just fine or okay.

region:

country:
None
text:
This recipe was pretty good, but definitley not like a traditional beef stroganoff.  I omitted the chopped onion, used 2 cans golden mushroom soup, 1/2 cup water, 1 packet beef bouillion, few dashes garlic powder, few dashes black pepper, used 4 oz cream cheese and few tbsps sour cream then thickened the sauce with cornstarch.  5-6 hours on low was long enough to cook it, sauce started burning around edges around 5-1/2 hours on low so adjust cooking time.

text:
I read some of the other reviews before making this recipe and decided to follow their lead and make some substitutions/additions.  I used beef broth instead of water, sour cream instead of cream cheese, and I added a 1/2 packet of dried onion soup mix.  The soup mix made my condo reek!  I was concerned that this would end up tasting strongly of onions but it turned out really well!  I will definitely make this again, but omit the soup mix.

userID:
2303283
Display Name:
Tracy
isPro:
False
followersCount:
1
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
3
favoritesCount:
79
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614246.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made this recipe with the suggestions I gained from the other reviews (1/2 sour cream/ 1/2 cream cheese; 1/2 packet of onion soup mix; 8oz of sauted mushrooms; turned the quarter cup into beef broth). The major difference I did was instead of beef I made this with venison. Since I prefer beef over venison but want to make my hunting husband happy I wanted to find a recipe that we would both enjoy. I didn't have all the ingredients and needed to run to the store while still getting this going in the crockpot for dinner -- I browned the venison in some vegetable oil and 5 minced garlic cloves and then put that in the crockpot. Then I sauted 3/4 of an onion and added that to the pan. When I got back from the store I added the remaining ingredients and let it cook for 1 hour more (6-7 hours total for the meat). The meat was super tender and we loved the rich flavor. I doubled the batch so that we could have have lunches for a couple of days. Will definitely be making again using either beef or venison. We ate ours over wide egg noodles.
Review:
Rating:
4
dateLastModified:
2010-09-20T20:12:13.113

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I thought this recipe was easy to make and tasted great.  I did use a little variation based on JILLYBEAN's review that I think made it much better.  I did forget to use the sauteed mushrooms and really think that would have made it just so much better.  Also, instead of cubed beef stew meat I actually took 3 steaks out of the freezer and cut those into cubes and added them to the slow cooker still moderately frozen.  Stew meat would probably have been fine but I'm always concerned it will come out tough.  I also added uncooked Egg Noodles to the pot about 20 minutes before serving (enough time to let them cook).  I used an entire bag.  This worked well if you don't want to dirty an additional pot but next time I'll try just putting the stroganoff on top of the noodles and see how that works out.  All in all a great recipe and my husband loved it.

userID:
4778689
Display Name:
erinwilson311
isPro:

followersCount:
0

4

recipesCount:

reviewsCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614252.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was very good. I made a few changes also as others did. My first change was to flour the stew meat prior to placing in the crock pot.  I just shook it in a ziploc bag with flour until coated. As per other suggestions I used double the mushroom soup, I used half a packet of onion soup mix, and half a packet of beef gravy mix. I also added 3 tsp of minced garlic. In addition, I used 1/4 cup water and 1/4 cup beef broth, although next time I may try using less liquid and perhaps using a little red wine as well for flavor (I had to use a little cornstarch mixed with cold water to thicken the sauce). I also added some mushrooms to this as well. I opted to use sourcream versus cream cheese. I used 4 oz initially and added more to taste. I served over buttered egg noodles. This was an easy base recipe that can be easily tweaked to specific preferences. Loved it and even the picky children in the family enjoyed it! It's on their "make again list"!

text:
I followed other reviews and make the following changes: doubled the meat, soup, and water, and used 1/2 onion chopped (did not measure). I also added pepper and 1/2 T minced garlic. I cooked on low for 6 hours. 30 minutes before serving, I sauteed 8 oz fresh white mushrooms in butter and added to the slow cooker. I added a big spoonful of sour cream and the cream chese (4 oz) right before serving. I served it over egg noodles. It was delicious. I will definitely be making this again!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was a great recipe!  I followed another reviewers suggestions in using 2 cans of soup and doubling the water.  I also added salt and pepper, garlic and some onion soup mix.  I found it a bit salty for my taste, so I would omit the extra salt next time I make it.  I let it cook on high for 5.5 hrs and added in some sauteed mushrooms at the end with the cream cheese and some sour cream.  If this is your first time using beef stew meat like it was for me, don't worry... the longer you cook the meat, the more tender it gets.  I was afraid because at the beginning the meat seemed really tough, but by the end, it was very tender and started to fall apart.  Can't wait to make it again!!

text:
I'm giving this one a 4 because I loved it but my husband thought it was "ok".  I think he wants it more traditional, and I'm not sure what that entails but since a lot of people have mentioned sour cream I think I'll try it next time.  I'm starting to think the cream cheese thing is a hit or miss, though.  Also, the sauce DOES need to be doubled, otherwise its not nearly enough to properly cook your meat and coat your noodles.  We had fettucinne so we just ate it over that and it was yummy.  This is such a great recipe and SO easy that I'm going to keep trying to suit it to my husband's taste.

Display Name:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614262.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I took some advice here and did this and my kids and dh love it:  Makes 8 Servings  INGREDIENTS 2 lbs stew cubes (flour & brown quick in pan) 2 cans of condensed GOLDEN Mushroom Soup 1/2 beefy onion soup packet  1/2 cup of white cooking wine 2 tblspns of Worcestire Sauce 1 tblspn of flour 1/2 chopped yellow onion (put in pan w/ beef) 1 can beef stock 4-8 oz cream cheese 1 small thing of sliced mushrooms cremini fresh ground pepper  PREP: 1. Brown beef cubes w/ onion in pan, few mins. 2. Spray slow cooker w/ non-stick spray 3. Put beef & onion in slow cooker 4. Pour cans of soup and beef broth over beef 5. Add worshestire sauce 6. Add wine 7. Add half  dry onion soup packet (Half) 8. Fresh ground pepper 9. Stir 10. Set on LOW for 8 Hours

text:
Great stroganoff!   I made a few changes though. I used 1 1/2 lbs of stew meat, I put 3 cubes of beef bouillon in 2 cups of water along with the golden mushroom soup. 10 minutes before serving I mixed in 8 oz. of cream cheese and 1 cup of sour cream - this thickened the sauce and made that classic stroganoff flavor really come out.   If I had extra mushrooms on hand, I would have definetely sauteed and added them to the dish. I served this over egg noodles and everyone ate it up!

text:
The only thing I did differently from the recipe was added pepper (did not add salt as so many others suggested as condensed soup is usually plenty salty and it was a good call IMO). I also sautéed 8 oz of mushrooms and added at end plus a spoonful of sour cream.  It really is the perfect amount of sauce to meat ratio and the right amount for 4 servings. I did double it as I was feeding 5 adults and 2 kids and I had about 3 servings leftover.  It was a definite hit!

This is decent, but nothing to write home about. I followed the suggestions of other reviewers and added sauteed mushrooms toward the end (so glad I did), doubled the soup, water, and onion (also glad I did that), and added a bullion cube, as well as garlic, salt, and pepper. This would have been quite bland (and not saucey enough) without those changes. I don't plan on making this recipe again, but it does inspire me to try to come up with a crock pot version of my mom's stroganoff recipe.

text:
Absolutely loved this dish.  I would give it 6 stars if I could.  I took the other reviewers suggestions into consideration before preparing. I used the two cans of soup as directed, instead of two cans of water I used 1 1/2 and 1/2 beef broth. The last 2 hours I sauteed the fresh mushrooms in a tablespoon of butter and sprinkled garlic powder over them and then added them into the crock pot.  Finally, I used 3 tablespoons of cornstarch to make it just a little thicker gravy. A keeper in the favorites - I will definitely make this one again!.Thank you!

text:
This recipe was fantastic using JillBean14's and Momsavedbygrace's modifications. I did add salt,pepper and garlic powder to the floured meat before I browned it. I Mixed 1 Tbs. cornstarch in 2 Tbs. cold water and added that, then put in the sour cream and cream cheese. The sauce thickened up very nicely after about half an hour on high. Will make again and again!

text:
First off here are the changes I made (1st time making it and I doubled the recipe): Used 2 pounds of london broil (cubed), 1 can of Golden Mushroom & 1 can of Cream of Onion Soups, 1 cup small diced onion, 1T Worcestershire, 1/2 cup of water, 2T minced garlic, 1 beef bullion cube, and 1 can sliced mushrooms (drained the water). At the end I added 5 ounces low-fat cream cheese and 1T cornstarch + 2T water.  Served over buttered egg noodles. **Result** The sauce was a bit too thick (although I wanted a thicker sauce). The meat was wonderful but something was a bit off.. it was missing something that I couldn't pin-point. It was great as leftovers too. I will make again if I can figure out what was missing :)

Rating:
3
dateLastModified:
2009-10-12T18:37:32.68
helpfulCount:
0
userID:
1032812
Display Name:
Michelle Roth-Kiva
isPro:
False
followersCount:
97
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
1009
favoritesCount:
2526
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2689406.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was allright, but certainly nothing special - even with my ch. As many others have, I also took JILLYBEAN & jessilynn's advice. Here's what I did: a) tossed my meat w/ a generous sprinkling of pepper & seasoned salt, b) doubled the sauce ing. (i.e. 2 cans of golden mushroom soup AND 1/2 cup H2O) & c) add. an extra 1/4 c. chopped onion, 3 (minced) garlic cloves, 1/2 of a Lipton onion soup pk., a beef bullion cube & a "dollup" of sour cream (at the very end - w/ the cream cheese). Please note: it helps to soften your cream cheese in the micro. B4 adding it to the sc; it will melt much easier this way. I didn't think to do this, and, as a result, my stroganoff had tiny lumps in it (my fiance couldn't get past the "gross" lumps lol...). Oh, and you MUST use golden mushroom soup. It is very diff. from the standard cream of mushroom soup. For one, it has lg. chunks of mushroom in it. Since this recipe doesn't call for fresh mushrooms, it is imperative, then, to use the correct type of soup. My fiance & I don't like mushrooms (we like mushroom soups tho - go figure!), so we didn't add any, but if you like them, you should (they will enhance the end product,IMHO)! Served over buttered egg noodles w/ peas & croissants on the side, this was an "OK" dinner. I will not be making it again (I like my Can Opener Gourmet cookbook recipe much better), but if you like stroganoff, please give this a try! Tx. Jessica :)

I made this yesterday/last night. It was VERY easy to through together--that was a plus. It is really nice to have it cooking when you get home. text:
Wow! I did not expect this recipe to be THIS good.  After reading and reading past reviews, I took a chance on Jillypie's version and it was outstanding.  Three little things:  I had a problem getting the cream cheese to melt evenly, so next time I will soften it up in the microwave a little before adding it.  I also think that I will make two little changes, I'd like to try it with more sour cream - maybe 4 oz sour cream and 2 oz cream cheese - because I really like that sour cream flavor.  Also, next time I will add more sauteed mushrooms at the very end.  All-in-all a great recipe!

text:
Excellent base recipe...tweaked it a bit like other reviewers. Came out the best Stroganoff ever, and my 4 yr old asked if we could have it for dinner every night! Loved the tang of cream cheese in it! My changes...I used blade steak and browned the meat first,frying the onions as well. Added a bit of beef boullion to the water, and sprinkled 1/4 packet of onion soup mix over the meat in the slow cooker. I used cream of mushroom soup and canned mushrooms, and I wouldn't change it! Also tossed in a couple of tablespoons of sour cream with the cream cheese at the end. Served it on whole wheat broad noodles the first night with steamed veggies, and the next night I served it over boiled, slightly mashed baby white potatoes with a salad. Two totally different meals.  Absolutely delicious!!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was great!  Although, I did make a few changes. In addition to the meat and can of GOLDEN Mushroom soup I also added 1 can of Campbell's french onion soup.  I was running late for work and didn't have time to chop an onion and this worked great.  I had already added the water, but next time I will skip the water and just put in the onion soup.  I also doubled the Worcestershire sauce and added 6 large mushrooms sliced.  I let all this cook in the crock pot for about 5  hours and then it went to the keep warm setting for a couple more hours.  It looked a bit overcooked on the edges, but it was fine after I stired it.  When I got home, I turned the crock pot to high from the keep warm setting. Then I added salt, the cream cheese and about 1/2c of sour cream for the kick beef stroganoff needs.  This was very good!  Next time I will use 2 pounds of stew meat.  One was just not enough after adding the extra can of soup.  This is a great work night meal!!

text:
yummy! i loved the ease of the crock pot. I stayed with the original recipe for the most part, but i doubled. So i used 1 cream of mushroom and 1 cream of chicken. I also browned the steak and seasoned with steak seasoning before adding to the pot. Added garlic pwdr, onion pwdr, pepper and cayenne to soup mixture. Last i used the tub of cream cheese, let it get to room temp and it folded right in at the end of cooking. no lumps. i enjoyed this very much and will def be making again. ++ used water and didnt add beef broth or the onion soup mix like some suggested. That, with Healthy Choice cans of soup, and the sodium was reduced and still very flavorful.

text:
This was the best beef stroganoff I've ever had! I used 2 pounds of chuck roast and cut it myself. I used 3/4 cup of onions. I didn't have golden mushroom soup, so I used two cans of cream of mushroom(it was still delicious!) I did use the same amount of water and Worcestershire sauce that the recipe calls for. I also used 2 ounces of cream cheese and about half of a small container of sour cream. I cooked it on high for 1 hour and low for a little less than 4 hours. It was SO SO SO yummy! I cannot wait to make this again! The whole family loved it!

text:
This recipe turned out REALLY well despite my concerns because of the seemingly basic ingredients.  My whole family loved it!!!  I would, however, recommend making two batches at the same time.  I have two growing boys and a hubby - all who like seconds.  With two batches, I had enough leftover to make 2 - 3 good lunch dishes for one person.  The only thing I'd recommend is using a little less water.  We like our stroganoff more like a gravy and dished over egg noodles.  So I ended up adding a little cornstarch at the end to thicken the sauce.    Otherwise - GREAT GREAT - my sons gave it a 9+ out of 10 - a rare rating for picky kids.  Thanks for the recipe!!

I'm rating this even though I shouldn't because I didn't follow the recipe exactly.  Instead, I substituted 2 cups of milk in place of the cream cheese to make a sort of stroganoff soup (watching the waistline).  Also, doubled everything except for the meat, added garlic and 1 lb of lightly sauteed mushrooms.  Simple and delicious!  Great stroganoff taste without all the calories.  Very hearty, don't even need egg noodles (I prefer it without).  Thanks for the recipe!

text:
Yummy! I have a "tried & true" beef stroganoff recipe, but this is my new favorite. Using the slow cooker is fantastic because the meat comes out super tender. I only had 5 hours to cook mine (still did it on low) and the meat was still quite tender.  I added 1/2c beef broth and 1/2c red wine because for my taste there wasn't nearly enough sauce and with just the soup and 1/4 liquid it's really thick. I also added 1/2 packet onion soup mix for some extra flavor. The was the best stroganoff I've ever had, thanks!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I followed the recommendations and doubled the gravy and added pepper and a half a packet of onion soup. I also sauteed my onions and garlic and browned my stew meat before putting into the crockpot and I substituted beef broth for the water. I kept the cream cheese and worcestershire sauce amounts the same. I don't know why, but my crockpot seemed to cook as if it were on high instead of low, so my gravy kept sticking to the sides of the pot (burning) and meat got so tender it began to break up in the gravy. This was still good and I definitely will make it again, but I'm only giving 4 stars because I think it needs more liquid. The consistency was a little off in my opinion, but the taste was really good. Also be careful with adding the soup mix and subbing broth for the water--it can get salty. Next time I probably will not use the soup mix since I used fresh onions anyway.

text:
One word: INCREDIBLE. This was a really, really awesome meal and so easy. I followed all the recommended substitutions since they seemed to be a hit for everyone else: I used two cans golden mushroom soup and 1/2 cup beef broth (instead of water & bouillion cubes) so I'd have double the sauce. And  I added 1/2 packet of Lipton onion soup mix, fresh sauteed mushrooms, garlic, salt and pepper and served over egg noodles. I thought the cream cheese was super in it and only added it to the main pot. My husband opted to add a dollop of sour cream on top of his bowl. Either way, INCREDIBLE! Will make again and again.

userID:
2379815
Display Name:
rosyshell
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
171
favoritesCount:
814
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614252.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was good, and I will make it again.  I would give 5 stars, but I had to add some things to make this work for our tastes.  After mixing the soup, onion, and meat as the recipe states, I brought it up to temp on high for a couple of hours then down to low for the rest of the cooking process.  Rather than just water, I added a can of mushrooms undrained, and a beef bouillion cube.  Tasted the sauce and thought it needed something...  added garlic, a touch of salt, and pepper.  The sauce seemed a little thin, even after adding the cream cheese, so I made a corn starch slurry and that thickened it up nicely.  This also needed a healthy spoonful of sour cream for our tastes.  Served over buttered egg noodles.  Will make again, but with the changes I used this time.
Review:

5

text:
EASY, PERFECT STROGANOFF! I especially like the tender meat, it just falls apart & mixes with the sauce. Mmm!  I doubled the sauce and left the amount of cream cheese the same, as other reviews suggested, plus the dollup of sour cream.  I also added sauteed mushrooms in a white wine reduction toward the end.  I used 2 cans of "Cream of Mushroom with Roasted Garlic" soup instead of Golden Mushroom, added 1/2 packet of dry onion soup, slightly more water, & some black pepper. 
I didn't even tell my boyfriend it was "Stroganoff" for fear he would compare it to his mother's, but he LOVES it and wants it every week!

As written this isn't very good. But it did provide a good base to make changes & create my own version of Slow Cooked Beef Stroganoff. As we can't get Golden Mushroom Soup I just googled what was in it (beef stock, tomato paste & mushrooms) & added that along with some paprika & a packet of French Onion Soup mix. I added the cream cheese but it just didn't turn it into a creamy sauce so I added sour cream as well. This made the whole thing too rich so I would just use sour cream in the future.

text:
Thank you Jillybean and MomSavedbyGrace!  I combined their tips and came up with this (8 servings).
For more sauce to save for later...
1) I doubled the meat, soup, and onion but kept the rest the same
2) 4/5 cloves of garlic
3) 1 teaspoon of pepper
4) Half a packet of Lipton's Onion Soup mix
6) 8 fresh mushrooms, sliced
7) Added a dollop of sour cream at end

I still cooked it on low for 8 hours.  Served over egg noodles, it was absolutely perfect.  I loved it and my boyfriend loved it.

I followed jillybeans tips and also added a can of cream of mushroom soup and another 1/4 water b/c of my mistake. It turned out wonderful and was easy. Gave it four stars due to the change in recipe.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
OK, this is the best recipe I've ever made from this website, quite possibly one of the best darn tasting things I've ever made - period!  I used Jillybean's instructions but I didn't add in sour cream because I didn't have it and it really didn't need it...I just put 1/2 stick of cream cheese (4oz) and 1 tbsp of worcestershire like the original recipe said and doubled the golden mushroom soup and water.  I used two pounds of cubed beef.  I added the garlic, onion, 1/2 packet of onion soup and 1 8oz can of mushroom stems and pieces at the end, about 15 minute before I put the cream cheese in.  Put the cream cheese in about 15 minutes before you eat it, because it takes a few minutes to all break down.  Honestly people, this was so good it was like dessert...my boyfriend and I seriously could not get enough.  Next time I want to try it with low fat cream cheese and whole wheat egg noodles just to make it a little healthier.

text:
This is an excellent slow cooker recipe! I made all the changes suggested by jillybean such as doubling the sauce but not the cream cheese etc. Although, I do think I used 6oz of cream cheese instead of 4 oz. I did not add a packet of onion soup mix as I feel that would have been salt overload (not sure if jillybean suggested that but a lot of folks did) but I did replace the water with reduced sodium beef broth. Lastly I added some fresh thyme, and instead of buying stew meat I cubed a 2.25 pound eye round roast. This is one of the easiest recipes ever and the results are fabulous!

text:
Next time I'll follow Jillybean's version.  First time I did the straight version and wondered why it's a slow cooker recipe when all you need to do is pretty much just heat everything up except the stew meat, and even that you can buy pre-tenderized, although it costs more.  

It was edible, but I'm not fussy about my own cooking, especially when I'm hungry.  If I try the straight version again, I won't bother with the slow cooker and use either pre-tenderized stew meat or some other meat that doesn't need much tenderizing (cut-up round steak would probably work just as well).

text:
This was FREAKING AMAZING.

I did the following changes, though:
- doubled the recipe to accommodate the beef roast i had
- didn't have Worcestershire sauce, so I threw in a splash of soy sauce and steak sauce
- added salt, pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder
- left out the chopped onion
- used one can of golden mushroom soup, one can of cream of mushroom
- added some fresh thyme
- used neufachtel cheese instead of cream cheese (lower in fat, tastes just as good)

text:
MADE IT DAIRY FREE VERSION....AWESOME!!!  
I have never rated a recipe before but after the popularity of this recipe in my house I wanted to.I followed the extra advice given adding garlic,mushrooms ,salt and pepper and 1 pack of onion soup(no fresh onions at all)But what was awesome was that I MADE A DAIRY FREE VERSION ,and it still was sooo good. I bought tofutti cream cheese at trader joes ,added the same amount as the cream cheese and then didn't add sour cream at the end.... and me a dairy lover loved it as well as my hubby and friends. You can get dairy free sour cream but I didnt feel it really needed it. This is a awesome,easy recipeIll be making 4 ever

userID:

Display Name:
DELIDOGGY

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674141.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
My family didn't care for this,  probably because I followed the suggestion to add onion soup mix.  It just didn't taste like stroganoff should.  I also don't think the cream cheese adds anything except some smoothness, and isn't worth the fat and calories.  My favorite stroganoff recipe on this website is Daria's Slow Cooker Beef Stroganoff.  It's delicious with sherry instead of white wine and 8 oz  lite sour cream (14 oz is too much).  You don't need the water or flour, but if it's not quite thick enough for you, just mix a little water and cornstarch to add in.  Wait awhile though, because it will thicken as it cooks.  Also, you can use a different cut of meat than round steak.  I usually use sirloin that's on sale, and if you partially freeze or defrost it first, it's easier to cut into strips.  I'm not a purist, but cubed beef doesn't fit with stroganoff.  For a great cubed beef recipe, try the Hungarian Goulash II on noodles that's here on Allrecipes.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2008-02-26T12:46:52.19

text:
This is the best stroganoff ever!  I love the cream cheese in it rather than sour cream.  I do find that I prefer my sauce thicker than what it turns out to like, so I usually just add some cornstarch to thicken it up.  Also, I cannot usually find the golden mushroom soup, so I just buy a can of cream of mushroom soup and a small can of mushrooms (drained) that I cut up before putting in the crockpot.  Defiently try out this recipe.  It's easy and oh so delicious!

Good recipe for busy working parents. This is worth making again. city:

region:
